page.title: 10W.Ashby Sand & Gravel quarry
page.content: Excavating sand and gravel began at Furzehills in 1942, and it was transported in its excavated state to aerodromes in the area.In 1944 equip- ment for washing the sand from the gravel was installed and this is still in use today.More recent equipment includes two sand graders, giving soft and sharp textures.The gravel is graded by series of rotating drums,one inside the other,which have graded holes in them.Between 700-1,000 tons of sand and gravel are excavated in a week, the mixture being approximately half and half.Although the quarry supplied a ready mixed concrete firm at one time,customers now are mainly local builders.The pit is almost worked out but a few pockets of sand should give four years work.There are seven full time and two part time staff.
